question: What is the standard deviation of a random variable q with the following probability distribution? <image 1>
description:
The image presents a probability distribution for a discrete random variable \( q \). The table lists the values of \( q \) along with their corresponding probabilities:

- When \( q = 0 \), the probability is \( 0.25 \).
- When \( q = 1 \), the probability is \( 0.25 \).
- When \( q = 2 \), the probability is \( 0.50 \).

This information is sufficient to calculate the standard deviation of the random variable \( q \).
